name: TOI-813
scenarioDescription:
The TOI-813 Exoplanetary System


Overview

TOI-813 is a star with 1.32 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.94 times its radius. It is located 864.80 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 3.73 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

TOI-813 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the TOI-813 system


TOI-813 b

TOI-813 b was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.42 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The radius of TOI-813 b is 6.71 that of Earth.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system TOI-813, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS).
